column4: I have updated to the newest kernel 2.6.28-13 using automatic update.
after installation is done then I reboot my machine, then there are dual boot kernel which are :

if I choose 2.6.28-11 there would be no problem but when I choose 2.6.28-13, a problem appears in my NVidia driver which is not supported in kernel 2.6.28-13. I have reinstalling using NVIDIA-Linux-x86-96.43.11-pkg1.run from NVidia website but it tells the kernel is not supported
kernel 2.6.28-13-generic is the newest one right? but installing driver tells me it's not supported kernel. tell me the way out?

if I choose 2.6.28-11 there would be no problem but when I choose 2.6.28-13, a problem appears in my NVidia driver which is not supported in kernel 2.6.28-13. I have reinstalling using NVIDIA-Linux-x86-96.43.11-pkg1.run from NVidia website but it tells the kernel is not supported. the wayout please!
2.6.28-13 ?? what version of ubuntu are you running?
hmm.. my package mirror must be lagging a bit.. I'm still on 2.6.28-11
oh.. hang on.. there it is.. well.. lets see if I survive this
it installed the nvidia module and virtualbox modules... all good so far.. let's try a reboot.. brb
ok, now running the new kernel.. everything seem to work alright
